paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the stigma experienced by Black cardiomyopathy patients, including references to the TTR gene and its associated variant p.Val142Ile, but does not provide detailed penetrance data or individual case information.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic testing identified a pathogenic variant in the TTR gene, and this participant has symptoms that are associated with ATTR-CM.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with a genetic predisposition to ATTR-CM.

variants.population_frequency: 1 in 28 people of African ancestry inherit a genetic predisposition to ATTR-CM.
variants.additional_notes: The paper highlights the underdiagnosis of the variant in Black patients.
key_quotes: About 1 in 28 people of African ancestry inherit a genetic predisposition to ATTR-CM.
Only 11% of patients with heart failure who have the Val142Ile mutation have an official diagnosis of ATTR-CM.

extraction_metadata.notes: The paper primarily discusses stigma and does not provide extensive genetic variant data.
